natpmpd(8) System Manager's Manual natpmpd(8)

NAME

natpmpd —
NAT Port mapping daemon.

SYNOPSIS

natpmpd [-d] [-k mssclamp] [-x/y privateIfName] publicIfName

DESCRIPTION

natpmpd is a daemon implementing NAT-PMP. NAT-PMP is a protocol for handling port forwarding requests from clients behind a NAT. It is normally invoked by InternetSharing(8)

The options are as follows:

-x/y publicinterface
The private interfaces that need the use the service.

NOTES

com.apple/100.InternetSharing/natpmp PF anchor is required for this daemon to correctly function.

SEE ALSO

InternetSharing(8), pf.conf(5)
March 16, 2011 Darwin
